alert.note: Alert for Greater Oconee; Greater Pickens; Oconee Mountains; Pickens Mountains (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 23 at 9:15PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Pickens and east central Oconee Counties through 1000 PM EDT... At 915 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 4 miles east of Walhalla, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Walhalla, Pickens, Seneca, Liberty, Norris, Six Mile, Salem, Lake Keowee, Keowee Toxaway State Park and Jocassee Gorges. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Greater Oconee; Greater Pickens; Oconee Mountains; Pickens Mountains
